Focused on providing the best user experience, the MAG series has a simple installation process coupled with a friendly user interface making it the best choice for entry level gamers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works perfectly out of the box
reviews.reviewText: I had a great experience using this motherboard to upgrade an older system. Everything works out of the box using Windows 10. I didn't have to install any extra drivers or bloatware from the manufacturer.Setup and configuration was easy. All the connectors are accessible and nothing is placed in a weird spot, so cable routing was a snap.You should be aware that that there are a limited number of PCI lanes shared between the PCI-E connectors and the M.2 slots. It's not a big deal but read the motherboard manual for a complete description of all the PCI-E slot and M.2 slot configurations to understand how many lanes you can have accessible.For me, other than a video card I used one M.2 and a bunch of PCI-E x1 cards so the limited lanes wasn't an issue for me.The M.2 slot connected directly to the CPU is also right next to the CPU socket so be aware that there will be limited space around it for a large M.2 drive cooler with the CPU cooler next to it. I'd plan for that accordingly. You'll want to use that for your boot drive because it's the fastest M.2 slot on the board and doesn't waste any PCI-E lanes like the others do.I had to do a BIOS update and it was a little tricky; the MSI BIOS has no problem detecting USB thumb drives but the BIOS updater mode only supports specific USB thumb drives. So you will be able to see your USB drive easily in the MSI "Board Explorer" display, but still have the BIOS update tool be unable to detect it.I happened to have a bunch of old random USB thumb drives from 512MB to 8GB and just tried different ones until it worked. So if you have issues updating the BIOS it isn't you: it's the thumb drive and you'll just want to try a few. Not a big deal but this isn't clearly explained in the motherboard manual.The motherboard has HDMI and DisplayPort outputs but there is no onboard video; this only works if you have a CPU with integrated graphics. I didn't, I used a Ryzen 5900X so you'll need a PCI-E video card for most kinds of CPUs.The built-in WiFi works great. I didn't like the included antennas but it uses a standard WiFi antenna connector so you can put on other ones.So overall this is a great motherboard. Everything works, there's no hidden gotchas, and it is quite stable. Performance is exceptional. Since I had a lot of DDR4 RAM this was the newest motherboard I could get without having to dump the old RAM and buy a lot of DDR5 so I'm quite happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Never use MSI Dragon Center - But I still like their boards
reviews.reviewText: 3rd MSI board now. Wonderful feature set, power delivery, and esthetic. I had it sitting for a year waiting for reasonable GPU. But now, love this line of boards. Easily handles my 5700x 7900xt combo. Mild temps in the mid 50c with total board power being at 585watts < yes this board delivers power and stability. I felt like OCing all my parts just to see - now I have a nice undervolt and balance curve for most and draw 385watts max. Lots of connections m.2s, SATAs, USB3/C support and more. Got this for $149.99 always fair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High quality materials in a good motherboard
reviews.reviewText: High Quality Materials in a good motherboard were used here and the reason I bought this B550 motherboard to replace the B450 motherboard I used prior. Other reasons for purchase were the ability to flash the BIOS using a USB port on the motherboard, USB drive, and power supply with no GPU, CPU, or RAM needed and that the motherboard has 2 M.2 nvme slots on board that I can configure as a RAID system drive.Since I bought a MSI case to replace my old case after discovering this ATX sized mb did not fit into my old case I found it easier than normally is the case to connect all the wiring in the MSI case to the correct place on the MSI motherboard. And some of the wiring on the MSI case was combined into one connector making it even easier.The BIOS when newly unpacked was version 2.20 but I updated it to version 2.60.That I did not like was that even though my CPU and RAM are not designed to be overclocked or the voltages altered the BIOS allowed me to do that anyway and it wasn't obvious I had done that either from the BIOS GUI. I think it shouldn't allow me to do that, as it can read what they are, and I did get strange memory related blue screens in Windows until I realized it was probably a BIOS settings problem after which I set the settings in the BIOS back to defaults and had no problems since. The BIOS GUI is amateurish looking and difficult to read and interpret.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value and performance
reviews.reviewText: Purcahsed 2 of these for my sons gaming builds and love the quality and performance so after a couple months. Great 550 board for the money and the wifi is very good as well and was definitively worth the extra cost. I now have three of these boards in the home and mine is almost a year old and no issues. I would also mention that one of the boards I got for my youngest was “Renewed” and I was still just as satisfied. I do prefer buying new but in reality renewed has performed exactly as the new one I bought here as well. So, solid choice for a 550 build.
Quality motherboard with good features. 2.5 Ghz Ethernet, wifi, and bluetooth. It's great for gaming, and i love the fact that it has 2x M.2.I recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Problemas con driver de WiFi al instalar windows. No requiere flasheo para ryzen 7 5800X3D
reviews.reviewText: Tuve problemas para instalar el driver de wifi y como es necesario tener una conexion activa no hay forma de completar la instalacion. Lo resolvi con un adaptador wifi usb para completar la instalacion de windows, una vez completada pude instalar el driver correcto del sitio de MSI y todo funciona correctamente. La uso con un ryzen 7 5800X3D y no tuve que flashear el BIOS para que lo reconociera (enero 2023)

Yesterday, I opened my case to swap out the SSD on the board and found that the lwer right edge of ther board had sort of peeled off. I know what you are thinking but I swear this is NOT of my doing. As per 1st picture, that's not the original state of the peel. It was even more caved in and I went and try to scrape it off thinking that it was some sort of, idk, thermal paste of soemthing. End result - 1st picture. I did do quite a bit of stability test on the board as there's no official warranty (I think. Anyway, tried my luck registering the board with receipt on MSI's site and, as expected, they won't cover), so maybe the edge of the board melted or something (or maybe a cockroach came inside the system to bite it off? Idk)I also think this might be a refurbished board (perhaps by MSI themselves instead of Amazon or whoever Amazon got this board from as the rest of the packaging looks totally new) instead of a new board. Judging from the 2nd picture, it looks like some sort of liquid stain is on the heatsink and dried out.Despite all of that though, board works totally fine. I tested almost all the ports of the board (except for the 2 unpopulated DIMM slots, the type-C ports, PCI-e x1 slots and 2nd gpu slot) and nothing is wrong so far. Overall, a value for money purchase thus far (will update if that peel caused issues)

reviews.reviewTitle: Reliable Motherboard with some nice to haves
reviews.reviewText: It's a good quality motherboard with some good features like the great ethernet, wifi, and bluetooth connectivity. It's great for a basic gaming setup, and the 2x M.2 slots make it pretty upgradeable. Would recommend if you're not doing anything like water-cooling or overclocking, just building a standard air cooled gaming PC in an ATX form factor
